Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 11.6 and σ = 0.2. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 20% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 10.8477
* 10.9562
* 11.4317
* 11.9279

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 10.8477: Incorrect
* 10.9562: Incorrect
* 11.4317: Correct
* 11.9279: Incorrect
